Pope Benedict XVI announced the first Native American saint during Mass at St PERIOD Peters Square in Rome Sunday PERIOD

The 17thcentury newly proclaimed saint Mohawk Kateri Tekakwitha was among the seven saints to be canonized PERIOD

The seven new saints include Marianne Cope of the United States Jacques Berthieu of France Pedro Calungsod of the Philippines Anna Schaeffer of Germany Giovanni Battista Piamarta of Italy and Maria del Carmen of Spain PERIOD

Born  in what is now upstate New York Tekakwitha was disfigured and partially blinded by smallpox PERIOD She was thrown out of her tribe and converted to Christianity at age  PERIOD She died four years later PERIOD

Tekakwitha lived a simple life of service with faith and purity the pope said PERIOD

Holiness is absolutely a matter of equal opportunity but this certainly is special because it marks the first time a Native American becomes a saint said George Burke Vatican senior communications advisor PERIOD
